page.title: 15 THE 5TH FARNHAM SCOUTS
page.content: The Scout movement in The Bourne is very popular.There are 102 cubs divided betweeen Wolves and Tigers packs and there are 52 scouts divided into The Fox and The Bourne Troops.The cubs are fortunate in having an Arkela who has given her time,energy and devotion to the 5th Farnham Cubs for 30 years;she runs both packs.The scouts have two leaders,both have been with the troops for over 20 years. The 5th Farnham meet at the Scout Hut (Taylor's Hall),opposite the Fox Inn,Frensham Road. The Farnham District Scout Group own 7 acres of land,Garner's Field, situated near the River Wey, not far from the ruins of Waverley Abbey. The Bourne scouts make good use of this for day,weekend and week camps. They have recently planted many young trees on the land. Nearby,The County Girl
